57448d04-d8a3-455f-82e4-84702bcc9004.description: NALA members display dedication, participation, and enthusiasm within NALA and the paralegal field. Joining NALA gives members access to several benefits to help advance their careers. These benefits include the following: access to SimpleLaw, an online platform where members can grow their contract income opportunities; a subscription to NALA’s elite quarterly magazine Facts & Findings; access to NALA Commons, a member-only collaborative site; online job searches; various discounts; and more.
57448d04-d8a3-455f-82e4-84702bcc9004.name: NALA Member

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

badge_template_activities.title: NALA memberships are categorized into four membership types: active, sustaining/associate, student, and organization. Each membership type requires certain criteria to join. Only active type membership receives full benefits including voting privileges within the organization and can serve on a committee.
NALA memberships must be renewed annually.

8faf9a47-f104-411c-a8bf-a47fc6922ddb.description: Becoming a NALA Certified Paralegal (CP) means an individual has successfully passed a rigorous examination of the knowledge necessary to be an effective paralegal. The voluntary CP program encourages the growth of the paralegal profession while also providing a proud achievement that comes with a career-long commitment. Established in 1976, the CP credential is key to respect and opportunity throughout the legal profession and is the national professional standard for paralegals.
8faf9a47-f104-411c-a8bf-a47fc6922ddb.name: NALA Certified Paralegal

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

alignments.name: National Commission for Certifying Agencies
alignments.description: The National Commission for Certifying Agencies (NCCA) is an accrediting body of the Institute for Credentialing Excellence (ICE).

badge_template_activities.title: Applicants must meet one of three eligibility requirements. The applicant must graduate from a paralegal program, have obtained a bachelor’s degree in any field plus one year of paralegal experience or successful completion of at 15 semester hours of substantive paralegal courses, or have obtained a high school diploma or equivalent, plus seven years of experience as a paralegal plus a minimum of 20 hours of continuing legal education completed within two years of applying for the exam.

Applicants must successfully pass the two-part Certified Paralegal comprehensive exam based on federal law and procedures. The multiple-choice Knowledge Exam must be passed before the applicant can take the essay-based Skills Exam. Successful completion of both the Knowledge and Skills Exams are required to obtain the Certified Paralegal credential.

NALA Certified Paralegals must renew their certification every five years. Recertification requires proof of 50 completed hours of Continuing Legal Education (CLE) courses with at least 5 hours of legal ethics within the five years. A CP must also have not been convicted of a felony during this time. CPs must continually work to maintain proper certification. Lifetime certification is not available due to the continual change in laws and procedures.

4c4f8d58-75d5-4992-9ae8-32068e09129b.description: The distinguished Advanced Certified Paralegal (ACP) credential courses are designed to advance education by learning specific areas of law, rather than just testing current knowledge. Applicants must successfully complete a rigorous course and maintain CP certification. Upon successful completion of the program, ACPs are certified to provide advanced paralegal services and entitled to the use of the designation ACP in connection with paralegal services offered in their specific area of study.
4c4f8d58-75d5-4992-9ae8-32068e09129b.name: NALA Advanced Certified Paralegal

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

alignments.name: National Commission for Certifying Agencies
alignments.description: National Commission for Certifying Agencies through Institute for Credentialing Excellence.

badge_template_activities.title: ACP courses are available for anyone; however only a current CP can obtain the ACP credential upon completion of an advanced course. The individual does not have to be certified through NALA to qualify for the program. They must earn and maintain their CP to qualify for the ACP program.

An assessment component is part of the curriculum-based program, as well as interactive exercises. The average course is about 20 hours in length and organized into multiple chapters, so individuals can earn up to 20 hours of CLE for completing an ACP course.

NALA Advanced Certified Paralegals must renew their Certified Paralegal (CP) certification every five years. When the CP is renewed the ACP is also renewed. ACPs must continually work to maintain proper certification. Lifetime certification is not available due to the continual change in laws and procedures.

fcffdf0f-5cc1-479b-b9d0-10fc6673b5d1.description: Attendance on July 22 - 24, 2021, was required at the 2021 NALA Conference @ Home to earn this badge. The attendees joined fellow paralegals and law professionals for virtual annual meetings, as well as virtual education sessions with exceptional speakers to earn up to 11 Continuing Legal Education (CLE) credits for the live event.
fcffdf0f-5cc1-479b-b9d0-10fc6673b5d1.name: 2021 NALA Conference @ Home

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals must pre-register for the virtual conference and attend live in order to receive credit for CLE courses provided under the registration fee.

7ce0d987-d0c8-4e93-a98e-04a3ab5ca3fa.description: Attendance on July 14 - 16, 2022, was required at the 2022 NALA Conference & Expo to earn this badge. The attendees joined either in-person (in Phoenix, Arizona) or virtually in the first-ever hybrid NALA Conference. All attendees were able to participate in this 3-day educational event featuring a great opportunity to network with like-minded professionals, upgrade your paralegal skills, earn CLE credit, and much more.
7ce0d987-d0c8-4e93-a98e-04a3ab5ca3fa.name: 2022 NALA Conference & Expo

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals must register for the conference and attend live in order to receive credit for CLE courses provided under the registration fee.

5f512960-aa16-4b09-af23-f856a11e194a.description: Attendance on July 9 - 11, 2020, was required at the 2020 NALA Conference @ Home to earn this badge. The attendees joined fellow paralegals and law professionals for virtual annual meetings, as well as virtual education sessions with exceptional speakers to earn up to 11 Continuing Legal Education (CLE) credits for the live event.
5f512960-aa16-4b09-af23-f856a11e194a.name: 2020 NALA Conference @ Home

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

badge_template_activities.title: Individuals must pre-register for the virtual conference and attend live in order to receive credit for CLE courses provided under the registration fee.

56dcf908-709f-46ca-91f4-8dacb29b1a67.description: The prestigious NALA Honorary Membership is awarded upon completion of being an Active Type member for 25 or more consecutive years. They receive all the benefits Active Type members receive, including the following: access to SimpleLaw; an annual subscription to NALA’s elite quarterly magazine Facts & Findings; access to NALA Commons, a member-only collaborative site; online job searches; various discounts; voting privileges; and more.
56dcf908-709f-46ca-91f4-8dacb29b1a67.name: NALA Honorary Member

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

badge_template_activities.title: Only individuals who have been an Active Type member in NALA for at least 25 consecutive years may qualify for an Honorary Membership. This membership is free; however, Honorary Members must renew their free membership annually.

dee8daf9-ea67-45ec-886d-f9e0447beb60.description: The NALA Governing Board is elected by Active Type NALA members. The Governing Board oversees the management of NALA, focusing on fulfillment of the organization’s mission and vision. Officer positions include: President; Vice President; Secretary; and Treasurer. Other Board members include Affiliated Associations Director; Area Directors; At Large Directors; NALA's CEO; and Chairs for the Certifying Board, Professional Development Committee, and Continuing Education Council.
dee8daf9-ea67-45ec-886d-f9e0447beb60.name: NALA Board of Directors (2019-2020 Term)

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

badge_template_activities.title: Only individuals are who are Active Type members of NALA may qualify to be on the NALA Governing Board of Directors.
Only individuals who are currently working in the paralegal field may run for office and serve on the NALA Governing Board of Directors.
Officials elected to the NALA Governing Board must be Certified Paralegals. They must also maintain their CP certification.

a2b658a2-a57c-4abf-974e-58dbf9d41a99.description: The Certifying Board is responsible for the content, standards, and administration of the Certified Paralegal® Program. In the technical areas of statistical analyses, exam construction, reliability, and validity tests, the Board contracts with a consulting firm offering expertise in these areas and in occupational research. Technical and content analyses of the CP Exam are conducted regularly to ensure the integrity and accuracy of the exam with job analysis studies conducted every six years.
a2b658a2-a57c-4abf-974e-58dbf9d41a99.name: NALA Certifying Board

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

alignments.name: National Commission for Certifying Agencies
alignments.description: The National Commission for Certifying Agencies (NCCA) is an accrediting body of the Institute for Credentialing Excellence (ICE).

badge_template_activities.title: It is composed of paralegals who have received an Advanced Paralegal Certification designation, attorneys, and paralegal educators.

8a2cc632-fbaf-477d-bca9-47d15b41f5b5.description: The PDC is responsible for maintaining the NALA Code of Ethics and Professional Responsibility; maintaining the NALA Model Standards and Guidelines for Utilization of Paralegals; providing articles for NALA's publication; overseeing the research and publishing of the biennial National Utilization and Compensation Survey; keeping up to date on summaries, opinions, and case law affecting the paralegal profession; and overseeing the creation of professional development courses.
8a2cc632-fbaf-477d-bca9-47d15b41f5b5.name: NALA Professional Development Committee (PDC)

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

badge_template_activities.title: Members are appointed for three-year terms. Terms of appointment shall be staggered as set forth in the policies and procedures of the Corporation. The Ethics Chairperson is on this committee

The NALA Code of Ethics and Professional Responsibility is the foundation of ethical practices of paralegals in the legal community. A paralegal must adhere strictly to the accepted standards of legal ethics and to the general principles of proper conduct. The canons are a general guide intended to aid paralegals and attorneys. Court rules, agency rules, and statutes must be taken into consideration when interpreting the canons.

Model Standards and Guidelines for the Utilization of Paralegals is to provide references to the existing case law and other authorities where the underlying issues have been considered. The authorities cited will serve as a basis upon which conduct of a paralegal may be analyzed as proper or improper. The Model represents a statement of how the paralegal may function. The Model is not intended to be a comprehensive or exhaustive list of the proper duties of a paralegal.

NALA’s award-winning quarterly journal, Facts & Findings, is a premier source of information designed specifically for paralegals. This magazine offers the best educational articles written by paralegals, attorneys, and other experts. In addition to feature articles, each issue includes columns on ethics, technology, and software.

The NALA Utilization and Compensation Survey is conducted every two years. The survey analysis includes reviews of current findings in comparison with findings of previous surveys. Economic data is presented in terms of such factors as the size of the city, size of the firm, educational backgrounds, years of experience, and specialty area of practice.

9d934927-9364-4f82-8660-002cf7f75af5.description: The CEC is responsible for developing and overseeing the NALA educational programs; maintaining and updating NALA’s publications; and producing Facts & Findings. The chairperson shall serve as editor of Facts & Findings.
9d934927-9364-4f82-8660-002cf7f75af5.name: NALA Continuing Education Council (CEC)

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

badge_template_activities.title: Members are appointed for three-year terms. Members of the council shall be Active type members of NALA and be actively employed as a paralegal or a paralegal educator. Terms of appointment shall be staggered as set forth in the policies and procedures of the Corporation.

NALA’s award-winning quarterly journal, Facts & Findings, is a premier source of information designed specifically for paralegals. This magazine offers the best educational articles written by paralegals, attorneys, and other experts. In addition to feature articles, each issue includes columns on ethics, technology, and software.
NALA's educational programs consists of live, on-demand, self-study, and in-person events.

15915414-9a66-4507-9961-ac4a4c72b90f.description: The NALA DEI Committee is responsible for furthering the goals of the Association to encourage, support, and maintain high standards in diversity, equity, and inclusion; monitoring DEI trends and issues; addressing DEI to foster or to cultivate meaningful, open, and constructive dialog to celebrate the diversity of the members and leaders; and strengthening diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives throughout the Association.
15915414-9a66-4507-9961-ac4a4c72b90f.name: NALA Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Committee (DEI)

issuer.summary: issued by NALA - The Paralegal Association

badge_template_activities.title: Members are appointed for two-year terms. Terms of appointment shall be staggered as set forth in the policies and procedures of the Corporation.
The DEI Committee produces a monthly article.
